name: Trombone - CSB
description: Cinematic Studio Brass Trombone. Powerful, resonant tone with wide dynamic range. Excellent for bold statements and dramatic passages.

legato.description: Legato is for MONO parts only - smooth transition between single notes. Enable legato (velocity ≥64) when playing single melodic lines. Disable legato (velocity <64) when 2+ notes sound simultaneously. Re-enable when returning to mono. Prefer keyswitch over CC for legato control.

orchestration_hints.character: Majestic, powerful, solemn. The backbone of brass harmony. Rich and resonant.
best_for: Dramatic bass lines in brass section

register_character.low: E2-Bb2: Powerful, dark, foundational. Great for bass lines.
register_character.mid: Bb2-F4: Rich, noble, most versatile. Primary working range.
register_character.high: F4-Bb4: Bright, intense, demanding. Use for climaxes.

ensemble_tips: Forms the middle voice in brass chorales
Can double bass/cello for power in low register
Balance carefully - can easily overpower other instruments
avoid: Competing with horn in mid-register melodic passages

ai.system_prompt_template: Generate trombone parts for Cinematic Studio Brass. Use CC1 for dynamics on long articulations, velocity for short articulations. LEGATO: Keyswitch Ab1 toggles legato (velocity ≥64 on, <64 off). IMPORTANT: Legato is for MONO parts only - use it for smooth note-to-note transitions in single melodic lines. Disable legato before any polyphonic passages (2+ simultaneous notes), re-enable when returning to mono melody. Switch articulations via CC58. Playable range E2-Bb4, preferred G2-F4.
